intro: Bellevalia koeiei, commonly known as the Koeiei bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal rosettes of narrow, gray-green leaves. Its showy, blue to violet flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Bellevalia koeiei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
